1.title: Hair Weave Mix-Up
1.plot: Judge Warren Sapp rules on the sale of a bad hair weave. Sheree Clausell is suing Byron Barnett for $500 as a refund for the poor quality of the hair extensions he sold her.

2.title: Sex for Rent
2.plot: Judge Warren Sapp rules on a "Roommates with Benefits" case. Craig Breaker is suing Monica Chanel for rent money. She claims he propositioned her, offering to allow her to live rent free in exchange for sex.

3.title: Money & Friends Don't Mix
3.plot: Najai Okharedia is suing her former best friend Brittney Gregg for $1,000, which she loaned her for rent and bills. Najai claims she only lent Brittney the money because Brittney promised to pay her back. But Brittney claims she's repaid Najai back by taking her to clubs, buying drinks, expensive dinners, and always driving her places.

4.title: Bisexual Love Triangle
4.plot: Vanessa Loghan is suing her boyfriend, Randy Marks, for damages to her vehicle and for credit card charges he ran up during a trip to Santa Barbara. Randy who brought his lover Ben on the trip, claims that he had never agreed to pay her back and she is only suing him because she doesn't accept his bisexuality.

5.title: Hot Dog Cart Fiasco
5.plot: Sergio Alvarado is suing his brother, Rudy, over money he loaned him for a hot dog cart. Sergio Alvarado claims he loaned his brother, Rudy Alvarado $3000 to purchase a hot dog cart and start a family business with his son, Rudy Jr. (aka "Wolf"). Sergio claims he gave Rudy the $3,000 as a loan expecting it to be paid back in full. When the business failed, Rudy sold the cart and paid Sergio back $1500. Sergio claims it wasn't an investment but a loan he wants the remaining $1500 that he feels he's owed.

6.title: A Model Wants Justice
6.plot: Jack King is suing his former model client, Jessica Suyama, for $250 for unpaid management services. Jessica Suyama says Jack was shady and unprofessional and claims she never signed a contract with him.

7.title: Deadbeat Skater
7.plot: Deseree Martin is suing her boyfriend Justin Owens for $1,000, which she loaned him for a skateboarding competition he never entered. He claims the money was a gift and that he shouldn't have to pay her back.

8.title: Drag Race Wreck
8.plot: Ruben Luna is suing his childhood friend Shawn Floyd for $5,000, for totaling his rental car. Shawn claims he helped Ruben with the payment but feels that he isn't solely responsible for the damages and refuses to pay Ruben another cent.

9.title: Drag Queen Brawl
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Broken Heart, Busted Computer
10.plot: Jasmine Jackson is suing her ex-boyfriend Donte Johnson for $600 for damages to her computer. Jasmine claims Dante suspected her of cheating so he stole and hacked into her computer and then broke it.

11.title: Stripper Makes It Rain
11.plot: Barbie Kingsley, an exotic dancer is suing a client, Manny Alvarez, for refusing to honor an agreement they made. Barbie claims Manny said he would "make it rain" and pay her $3000 if she did her signature dance move for him. Barbie and Manny have two very different accounts of what went down that night.

12.title: Gold-Digger Crash Confusion
12.plot: Kamyrn Overton is suing his childhood friend Paris Scott for $560 for damages to his car. Kamyrn claims Paris borrowed his car and wrecked it. Paris says Kamryn is a lying gold digger who made up this story just to get money from her.

13.title: Dropped Relationship
13.plot: Samn Allen is suing his ex-girlfriend Tyra Nichole for an unpaid cell phone bill. Tyra says she never agreed to pay for the phone. Tyra also claims Samn thought she was cheating on him, and that he's just bitter and trying to get back at her.

14.title: The Spanks-giving Special
14.plot: A Dominatrix, Tiffany Baker, claims a client, Jerome Jenkins owes her money for services rendered. Jerome says the domination went above and beyond the services they agreed to.

imdb.title: Judge Sapp
synopsis: In Warren Sapp's court, real people resolve real issues before one of sports' most outrageous and outspoken personalities. Donning a robe and wielding a gavel for the first time, Judge Sapp won't take any nonsense as he presides over his court. Unlike the People's Court, Judge Sapp features a DJ - Olympic snowboarder Louie Vito - and settlements determined by a casino-style wheel.
